There are two sections to this answer, one for the purists, and the other for people, who are really looking for a free iPhone. Section 1:Firstly, nothing is this world, is for free. If you judge something as being 'free' only because it doesn't cost any money, then that is an error in judgement in my opinion. You always have to give something to get something in return. Always. (Except for mother's love, maybe)Think about it, even a beggar puts in a lot of effort to 'earn'/'beg' (whatever you want to call it) his money, by slogging it out throughout the day, usually in unhygienic conditions. So the payment he makes here is in the form of his effort. Regarding the question asked here, it is clearly evident that you are looking for a shortcut to success, and haven't yet realized that it is non-existent. I would advise you to look for ways to work hard and earn money instead, and THEN go on to buy an iPhone with that. It would surely feel much better than if it was bought with someone else's money. If you are satisfied with this answer, then you should stop reading now. If not, and you really want a free iPhone, then keep going.  Section 2: This is for those people who are blessed with immense luck. If you think that you stand a great chance to hit the jackpot if you buy a lottery ticket, this one is for you. There are many tech companies that hold international giveaways for new, popular products. One I can think of is the recent Samsung Galaxy S6 giveaway by Android Authority. You can look for similar giveaways where the prize is an iPhone. If you are lucky enough, you might just end up with a brand new Apple product.  Since you are still reading, I shall assume that you might have read the first section as well. As I had mentioned there, NOTHING is for free. You need to have a great amount of luck on your side to win an International Giveaway. Cheers, and thanks for A2A!

I mean it would be very hard to get an iPhone for absolutely no cost whatsoever but you can definitely get a nice phone for very cheap if you buy it the right way. Most people sell cracked iphones on apps like Letgo, Offer up, 5miles relatively cheap. So maybe look there and get your screen replaced and you could be looking at a used iphone for around 200$. I would also try asking people you know personally if they have an old iphone laying around, I bought my phone (cracked 6s) from this girl for 150$. I replaced the screen myself, screen costing me 35$ . For 185$, I essentially have a brand new phone that sells on apple’s website for 400 to 500$. If you do buy a used iphone off someone you’ll want to check the imei number to make sure its not blacklisted/icloud locked or bad esn. Basically checking the imei will tell you if its been stolen and put in lost mode, and you can aslo see if the person is still making payments with their network. You want to buy a 100% clean phone, not signed into icloud as well. Definitely do some research because phones that are locked in that way are often sold extremely cheap (because they are basically useless). You don’t want to spend 100$ and find out what you bought has no use to you, believe me!

YES you would be earning 17 K profit plus you would use the IPHONE X for 24 months for effectively FREE !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Let me save you some time… no there is no such thing as a free lunch Any website or “scheme” that tells you otherwise is just taking advantage of you. If you really want an iPhone however… Do odd jobs and start saving up. Give fast food a miss- the cost can really add up.Try save a small amount every day. $2 or so every day gets big quick.Every time you spend- think about your goal of an iPhone and if you really need it.Buy used and save money If you are willing to go back a generation or two you can save a solid amount.Take advantage of the used market- keep your eyes open on eBay and the like.Reevaluate your expectations An iPhone 6 can be had for under $400 USD and will still run the latest iOSiPhone SE can be very cheap and will get you into apple’s ecosystem while still having the horsepower of an iPhone 6SHope this helps! Jack

I am personally more happy to buy some older iPhone or Android phone than make myself look miserable to myself and hope to win an iPhone. Not gonna lie.. I did put my name in some of such giveaways but never won any lol. I didn't wanted to product either lol.. it was a galaxy fold phone… Ew.. but anything free is always welcomed.

You won’t get one for free. However, there are several carriers that offer contracts. Of course, you’d have to meet the monthly payment requirements. For me, this is the cheapest way to get one. And, if you are in the USA, most carriers offer a free upgrade when a new iPhone is released. Also, you can always buy a version or two lower than the latest. For example, as of writing, you should be able to get the iPhone 6 at a really good price whether second hand or brand new on Amazon, eBay or even from a carrier. Best regards, Jesse

The Answer is NO. The popups on websites “congratulations you have won yourself an iPhone” are click and bait strategy that either downloads malware and virsues on your computer or may later ask you to deposit some kind of money to release your gift. The Facebook post by fake Apple/iPhone pages claiming to be giving away some hundreds/ thousands iPhone as anniversary gift, special promotion, customer appreciation blah blah blah if you like their page and share the post is another scam and nobody should fall for it. If it Sounds Too Good to Be True, it Probably Is. The only people I know who get free iPhones are apple reps, 3rd party re-sellers that exceed sales targets.

Q: How do I get an iPhone for free? A: Oh, that would be pretty easy. You just have to truly desire it. It’s just navigating on a river. If you want to go downstream, it will be relatively easy to find a floating piece of wood or something, embrace it and let the water carry you. Many people will be able to do so. The hard thing is to navigate upstream. Or, for example, to resist “consumerization”, run Free Software and avoid the many lock-ins “offered” by the proprietary iOS, in a world where carefree people just go downstream by the river…

response.answer_text: Getting an iPhone for free, is impossible. The only way on getting an iPhone for free is to just buy it. Forget about those scams that say “Win an iPhone by clicking this link!!!” “You win 1999999 iphones when u click this site” or any other way, they’re saying to visit their clumsy website for no reason. Oh wait, while you can’t get an iPhone for free, you can participate in giveaways, or if you have a birthday or christmas party or halloween or whatever, they might give you an iPhone as a gift. BUT I AM TELLING YOU; DO NOT VISIT THOSE SCAMS.

If you watch youtube videos, you might have seen that there are several “techtubers” who conduct giveaways for free iPhones, laptops, GPUs, etc. They are sponsored by some company and are generally true. That’s more like a lottery ticket. If luck’s on your side, you might eventually end up having one. Generally, giveaways are the only place you can get an iPhone for free. But who knows, keep your eyes on the street if someone drops their iPhone without realising. LOL :D Hope you get one soon

You could try using Swagbucks. It will probably take quite some time though. The most I’ve managed to earn with their points system is a 5$ Amazon Gift Card (after many months). Maybe you’ll have better luck with it though. You get points by doing searches (basically use it instead of google). Playing online games, and watching videos on their site. But really, you should probably just work hard and earn an iPhone properly, by getting a job.

Some cell phone carriers will completley subsidize the price of an older iPhone like a 6s or SE so that you don’t pay anything for the iPhone, just for the cell service. The cost of the iPhone is more than covered by what you pay for service, so, technically, you do end up paying for the phone, but you don’t have to pay out a bunch of money up front. Now, if you just want a totally free iPhone, that ain’t happening. You can’t get something for nothing.
